maml:description.maml:para: Connect to a UCS instance using the standard Asurion read-only account.
Returns a UCS Connection Object using the standard Asurion read-only UCS account.

maml:Description.maml:para: {{Fill UCS Description}}
{{Fill UCS Description}}

maml:alert.maml:para: You should always clean up by calling Disconnect-UCS -Ucs <$Connection Object Variable>

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a dataset object.
Returns a dataset object by executed a query against a database based on the connection string supplied.

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter is required to connect to a database to run a query. This is a standard format connection string. A default is used if not supplied. To see the default run cmdlet: Get-UCSConnectionString.
This parameter is the database query to run. This ideally would be a select statment of some kind.

This parameter is required to connect to a database to run a query. This is a standard format connection string. A default is used if not supplied. To see the default run cmdlet: Get-UCSConnectionString.
This parameter is the database query to run. This ideally would be a select statment of some kind.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-DatabaseData -verbose -connectionString (Get-UCSConnectionString) -query "Select InstanceName From UCSInstances Where Status = 'Online'"

maml:description.maml:para: This function returns a connection string for the UCS database.
This function is a easy place to store the connection information for the UCS database.
Collect all data from a UCS instance and write the results to the database as a new dataset.
Collect all data from a UCS instance and write the results to the database as a new dataset.

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter is the UCS entry to update in the database.

This parameter is required to connect to a database to run a query. This is a standard format connection string. A default is used if not supplied. To see the default run cmdlet: Get-UCSConnectionString.
This parameter is the UCS entry to update in the database.

This parameter is required to connect to a database to run a query. This is a standard format connection string. A default is used if not supplied. To see the default run cmdlet: Get-UCSConnectionString.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the status of a UCS Instance in the database
This function is used to get the status of a given UCSInstance in the database. This status determines if the UCS Instance will be included in the results returned by Get-UCSInstanceList

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter is the UCS entry to update in the database.
This parameter is the UCS entry to update in the database.

dev:remarks.maml:para: RID : 23 InstanceName : LABUCS002 IPAddress : 10.0.34.200 Location : Nashville Notes : CoreDmz : Core Status : offline DataCenter : LAB
RID : 22 InstanceName : LABUCS001 IPAddress : 10.0.34.100 Location : Nashville Notes : CoreDmz : Core Status : Online DataCenter : LAB
RID : 3 InstanceName : NPRUCS001 IPAddress : 10.2.99.10 Location : Nashville Notes : CoreDmz : Core Status : Online DataCenter : NPR

RID InstanceName IPAddress Location Notes CoreDmz Status DataCenter --- ------------ --------- -------- ----- ------- ------ ---------- 1 NDCUCSTEL 10.2.32.67 Nashville Core Online NDC 2 SDCUCSTEL 10.4.32.67 Sterling Core Online SDC 3 NPRUCS001 10.2.99.10 Nashville Core Online NPR 4 NDCUCS001 10.2.58.36 Nashville Core Online NDC 5 SDCUCS001 10.4.53.70 Sterling Core Online SDC 6 SYDUCS001 10.79.34.33 Sydney Core Online SYD 7 SYDUCS002 10.79.34.105 Sydney eDMZ Online SYD 8 NEDUCS001 10.3.36.32 Nashville Core Online NED ...

maml:description.maml:para: This function returns a list of UCS Instances in the UCS database that have a status of 'online'.

This function returns a list of UCS Instances in the UCS database that have a status of 'online'. Use Get-UCSInstanceStatus to check the status and Set-UCSInstanceStatus to change the status of a UCS instance.

maml:alert.maml:para: I need to add a parameter to allow returning all UCS Instances regardless of status.

dev:remarks.maml:para: InstanceName ------------' NDCUCSTEL SDCUCSTEL NPRUCS001 NDCUCS001 SDCUCS001 ...

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the status of a UCS Instance in the database
This function is used to get the status of a given UCSInstance in the database. This status determines if the UCS Instance will be included in the results returned by Get-UCSInstanceList

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter is the UCS entry to update in the database.

This parameter is required to connect to a database to run a query. This is a standard format connection string. A default is used if not supplied. To see the default run cmdlet: Get-UCSConnectionString.

This parameter is required to connect to a database to run a query. This is a standard format connection string. A default is used if not supplied. To see the default run cmdlet: Get-UCSConnectionString.

maml:description.maml:para: Collect power readings from a UCS instance and write the results to the database.
Collect power readings from a UCS instance and write the results to the database.

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter is the UCS entry to update in the database.

This parameter is required to connect to a database to run a query. This is a standard format connection string. A default is used if not supplied. To see the default run cmdlet: Get-UCSConnectionString.
This parameter is the UCS entry to update in the database.

This parameter is required to connect to a database to run a query. This is a standard format connection string. A default is used if not supplied. To see the default run cmdlet: Get-UCSConnectionString.

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes a database command.
This function is for running commands against a database other than select statements. This function does not return anything.

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter is required to connect to a database to run a query. This is a standard format connection string. A default is used if not supplied. To see the default run cmdlet: Get-UCSConnectionString.
This parameter is required. This is the query that will be executed against the database specified in the connectionstring.

This parameter is required to connect to a database to run a query. This is a standard format connection string. A default is used if not supplied. To see the default run cmdlet: Get-UCSConnectionString.
This parameter is required. This is the query that will be executed against the database specified in the connectionstring.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-DatabaseQuery -verbose -connectionString (Get-UCSConnectionString) -query "Update UCSInstance Set Status = 'offline' where InstanceName = 'LABUCS001'"

maml:description.maml:para: Collect all data from all of the UCS instances and write the results to the database as a new dataset.
Loop through a list of UCS Instances that is generated with (Get-UCSInstanceList) and collect all useful UCS data and write that data to the UCS database using a new DataSetID.
Collect power readings from all of the UCS instances and write the results to the database.
Loop through a list of UCS Instances that is generated with (Get-UCSInstanceList) and collect power usage stats and write that data to the UCS database.
Add a UCS Instance to the database
This function is used to add a new UCSInstance in the database.

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter is the UCS entry to add to the database.

This parameter is required to connect to a database to run a query. This is a standard format connection string. A default is used if not supplied. To see the default run cmdlet: Get-UCSConnectionString.
This parameter is the IP Address that the instance name resolves to.
This parameter is the location of the datacenter where this instance is installed. e.g. Nashville, Sterling, Sydney, etc...
This parameter is for notes.
This parameter is for the network location type. e.g. Core, eDMZ, iDMZ etc...
This parameter needs to be either 'online' or 'offline'.
This parameter is for the DataCenter code for where the UCSInstance is located.
This parameter is the UCS entry to add to the database.

This parameter is required to connect to a database to run a query. This is a standard format connection string. A default is used if not supplied. To see the default run cmdlet: Get-UCSConnectionString.
This parameter is the IP Address that the instance name resolves to.
This parameter is the location of the datacenter where this instance is installed. e.g. Nashville, Sterling, Sydney, etc...
This parameter is for notes.
This parameter is for the network location type. e.g. Core, eDMZ, iDMZ etc...
This parameter needs to be either 'online' or 'offline'.
This parameter is for the DataCenter code for where the UCSInstance is located.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-UCSInstance -UCS LABUCS002 -IPAddress 192.168.4.100 -Location Nashville -Notes 'In the lab yo' -CoreDMZ Core -DataCenter LAB

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes a UCS Instance from the database
This function is used to a given UCSInstance in the database.

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter is the UCS entry to update in the database.

This parameter is required to connect to a database to run a query. This is a standard format connection string. A default is used if not supplied. To see the default run cmdlet: Get-UCSConnectionString.
This parameter needs to be either 'Online' or 'Offline'.

This parameter is required to connect to a database to run a query. This is a standard format connection string. A default is used if not supplied. To see the default run cmdlet: Get-UCSConnectionString.
